IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText: List of Attachments: - Taneytown Police Initial Report. - Copy of body camera footage from Axiom - follow-up interviews with Bockelmann, Reed, Perdue, and Jackson. - Maryland Gun Center information on VERONIE. - Copy of written statement by Mason Conners (a Juvenile). Related Case Numbers: 23-TPD-000404 PFC J. Marshall (#0071) 410-751-1150 A copy of the initial report has been included with the case file for review. Location of Incident: 520 East Baltimore Street Taneytown, Maryland. According to Tanetown Officers, the incident occurred in the parking lot of that location, near the grassy hill that leads to Kennys Market. Date and Time of Incident: August 12, 2023 At approximately 08:40 P.M. Weapon Used: Victims/witnesses all gave similar descriptions of the firearm. Silver revolver with wooden handle. BOCKELMANN advised he believes it was a .357. Video of Incident / Surveillance Video: At this time, there is no known video of VERONIE pointing the firearm at any of the victims. There is also no known surveillance video from the surrounding businesses. Suspect: VERONIE, Nicholas Anson 03/20/2003 11336 Hessong Bridge Road, Thurmont, Maryland Phone: Unknown at this time. Possible phone numbers include: 301-748-1665 (Marci Veronie) and 240-674-4213. MD DL Number: MD10272770899 VERONIE IS ONLY 20 YEARS OLD AND PROHIBITED DUE TO AGE, PER THE MARYLAND GUN CENTER Victims: In this case, the subjects listed below indicated to either myself or Taneytown Police Officers, that VERONIE waved his firearm at all the people at the car meet - estimated based on statements and accounts by officers to 20 to 40 people. The following subjects are the only ones believed to be willing to speak about the case. These are all believed to be victims in this case, due to all indicating that VERONIE waved his firearm around the group of people. Logan Daniel BOCKELMANN (05/24/2004). 443-536-1736. 11 Courier Drive, Taneytown, MD. A written statement was completed on the day of the incident and is included in the TPD report. Provided a recorded interview with MSP. Christopher John REED (07/29/2004). 443-547-5265. 3322 Shiloh Road, Hampstead, MD. A written statement was completed on the day of the incident and is included in the TPD report. Provided recorded interview with MSP. Tyler Stuart PERDUE (11/23/2004). 443-904-1045. 631 Cockeys Mill Road, Reisterstown, MD. A written statement was completed on the day of the incident and is included in the TPD report. Provided a recorded interview with MSP. Colby Taylor JACKSON (11/25/2003). 443-547-0253. Provided recorded interview with MSP. There was no prior interview noted in the Taneytown Police report. Mason WALTRUP (02/14/2002) 410-299-2756. 4637 Watertank Road, Manchester, MD. A written statement was completed on the day of the incident and is included in the TPD report. Did not respond to TPD for a follow-up interview and no further contact has been attempted at this time. Nate Marsh 240-385-5812. Contact was able to be made with Marsh on September 6, 2023,and he agreed to provide a written statement about the incident. Once the statement is received, it will be included with the case file for review. Mason CONNERS (11/22/2005) - JUVENILE 443-536-4254 (or 4259). A written statement was completed on the day of the incident and provided to TPD Officers. Due to his age, it was not initially updated to their reporting system. In speaking with TPD Officers, it was determined that I would upload the written statement to my report. Since a written statement was provided, no further contact has been attempted at this time. I believe further review is needed by the Carroll States Attorneys Office due to the nature of the case. INFORMATION FROM TANEYTOWN POLICE REPORT: The following information came directly from the Taneytown Police Report and was included in this report due to the initial statements made to Taneytown Police Officers on the day of the incident. This information was copied directly from the report and not changed or edited. Please refer to the Taneytown Police Report if needed, which has additional information not listed below. BOCKELMANN stated that a W/M by the name of Nick (later identified as Nicholas Anson Veronie) had an incident the evening prior with friends of his, and was asked to leave the area because he was attempting to start a fight. BOCKELMANN stated that VERONIE showed up to the parking lot tonight and began making fun of another subject. BOCKELMANN stated that words were exchanged and BOCKELMANN asked VERONIE what he was carrying in his man purse. BOCKELMANN stated VERONIE pulled out a silver in color .357 pistol with a wood handle. BOCKELMANN stated VERONIE placed the pistol underneath his own chin and pulled the trigger. BOCKELMANN then stated that VERONIE then pulled the pistol from under his chin and pointed it at BOCKELMANNs chest and then began pointing the pistol at the crowd of people that were standing around BOCKELMANN. BOCKELMANN stated he then wrestled the pistol away from VERONIE and upon doing so was able to observe the pistol to have 4 bullets inside the ammunition cylinder. BOCKELMANN stated he then struck VERONIE in the face 3 times with his fist because VERONIE was attempting to grab the loaded firearm back from BOCKELMANN. BOCKELMANN stated he then removed the firearm from the crowd at which time VERONIE grabbed the pistol threw it in the back of his vehicle which was an H1 Hummer and proceeded to dump a full bag of trash in the parking lot before leaving. This was then confirmed by Tyler Perdue, Christopher Reed and Mason Waltrip who witnessed the incident. Perdue was able to provide me a full name of VERONIE, a vehicle description Green in color M1 Hummer that was possibly camolflauged and a tag number MD Dealer tag 1A98994. All of this was radioed to dispatch. An attempt to locate was then placed for Frederick County Sheriffs as well as MSP Frederick Barrack. An attempt to locate was then placed for Frederick County Sheriffs as well as MSP Frederick Barrack. BOCKELMANNs statement is as follows: I WAS HANGING OUT IN THE PARKING LOT WITH MY FRIENDS AN A KID NICK V. PULLED A GUN ON ME. HE ACTED LIKE HE WAS PLAYING RUSSIAN ROULETTE AN PROCEED TO POINT A GUN AT ME. I PROCEEDED TO DISARM HIM AN THAN IN SELF DEFENSE I PUNCHED HIM 3 TIMES IN THE FACE. WHEN HE POINTED THE GUN HE POINTED IT DIRECTLY AT MY CHEST. I FELT INFEARED FOR MY MY LIFE AN FOR OTHERS AROUND ME. I THOUGHT NICK WAS GOING TO SHOOT ME AND OTHER PEOPLE IN THE CROWD. PRIOR TO THAT HIS SILVER AN WOOD 357 MAGUM POINTED TOHIS CHIN, PULLED THE TRIGGER THEN HE POINTED THE GUN AT MY CHEST. I DID NOT KNOW THE GUN WAS LOADED BUT AFTER I DISARMED HIM I OPENED UP THE CANISTER AND I SEEN 4 ROUNDS IN THE CANISTER. END OF STATEMENT. PERDUEs statement is as follows: NICK VEROHI PULLED A GUN AFTER THERE WAS A CONFRONTATION ON TWO PEOPLE AND PULLED THE TRIGGER THEN HE SWEPT IT AROUND A GROUP OF ABOUT 10 PEOPLE AND ONE OF THE VICTIMS LOGAN TOOK THE GUN FROM HIM AND PUT IT INTO HIS CAR THEN LOGAN STARTED PUNCHING HIM IN SELF DEFENSE NICK GOT THE GUN OUT OF LOGANS CAR WENT BACK TO HIS DADS HUMMER AND PULLED OUT A TRASH BAG FULL OF TRASH AND OPENED IT AS HE WAS DRIVING AWAY AS HE WAS DUMPING OUT THE TRASH AS HE DROVE OFF. WALTRIPs statement is as follows: WE WERE SITTING JUST CHILLING AND THIS KID SHOWED UP AND PULLED A REVOLVER OUT OF HIS MAN PURSE AND POINTED IT AT LOGAN AND MASON THEN WAVED IT AROUND IN A CIRCLE MUZZLE FLASHING ALL OF US. I DUCKED DOWN TO AVOID ACCIDENTAL MISSFIRE. LOGAN THEN TOOK THE GUN AWAY FROM HIM AND PUT IT IN HIS CAR AWAY FROM HIM. THE KID SHOVED LOGAN THEN LOGAN DEFENDED HIMSELF. REEDs statement is as follows: LOGAN ASKED NICK IF HE HAD A GUN IN HIS MAN PURSE, HE PROCEEDED TO PULL A REVOLVER OUT AND POINTED IT AT HIMSELF AND PULLED THE TRIGGER IT DIDNT GO OFF. AFTER THAT HE POINTED IT AROUND THE CIRCLE THEN STOPPED AT LOGAN AND MASON. LOGAN TOOK THE REVOLVER AND THREW IT IN THE GRASS. NICK WENT AND PICKED UP THE GUN AND WENT BACK TO THE HUMMER HE CAME IN. WHEN HE LEFT HE THREW A BAG OF TRASH OUT THE WINDOW AFTER IT WAS OPENED. End of Statement************** Frederick County was unable to make contact with VERONIE. Narrative: I, Cpl. Theodore Buck of the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division became involved with this case after the fact, per the request of Taneytown Police. The following is a breakdown of what was reported to Law Enforcement, other investigative efforts, and things I believe are related to the case. Victim Interview All the victims are listed above. While there are some variations to the accounts, all victims reportedly VERONIE pulling a firearm out and pointed it at the crowd of people, as well as BOCKELMANN reported VERONIE pointed the firearm directly at his chest. Additional information includes Some witnesses indicatedVERONIE placed the firearm under his chin and pulledthe trigger. VERONIE pointed the firearm at everyone at car meet when he waved the firearm around. The description of the firearm also appears to be consistent. Recorded Interviews at TPD After learning about this case from PFC Marshall, I requested that the main parties involved be requested to come in for recorded interviews. Bockelmann, Reed, and Perdue initially showed up for interviews. Jackson agreed to come to speak with us after being contacted by one of the three victims who were already interviewed. Interview of VERONIE. Unable to make contact with VERONIE, so an interview could not be conducted. I have left messages on both phones listed above, Location of VERONIE after the incident. Law Enforcement responded to VERONIEs registered address and the vehicle in question was not observed. At this time, it is not known where VERONIE went after the incident. Potential of a search of VERONIEs registered address -11336 Hessong Bridge Road, Thurmont,MD. A search of this property was not conducted, since there is no known information to indicate that VERONIE went back to the property after the incident. At the time of this supplement, it was determined that a search warrant was not appropriate. Trash observed - supporting witness statements. Yes. Included with Taneytown Polices report is a photograph of trash that was located at the scene. VERONIE reportedly dumped a bag of trash out on the ground while leaving the scene, after pulling out the firearm. Firearms listed to VERONIE. NONE. VERONIE is also under 21 years old, and should not be in possession of any style of handgun. Firearms listed to the suspects father, Robert Nicholas Veronie. MD Gun Center Information labeled MAFSS LIST. The following information should be confirmed with the Maryland Gun Center. BER 950 Believed to be a Beretta 950. Not a revolver. SR 22 Charger Believed to be a Ruger 22 Charger. Not a revolver. GLC 19 Glock 19 (9mm handgun) Not a revolver. SR Charger (22 Caliber) Believed to be a Ruger Charger. Not a revolver. Surveillance Video or Video of the incident. No known video is available showing the incident or VERONIE pointing his firearm at other people. Other victims/witnesses As referenced above, other potential victims/witnesses were at the scene when the crime occurred. Case Disposition: At this time, I will be attempting to interview VERONIE. If no contact is made by September 8, 2023, I will proceed with applying for charges against VERONIE based on the statements made by the victims in this case. It should be noted that the Taneytown Police reviewed this case with the Carroll County States Attorneys Office, who advised charges were warranted. Case OPEN.

List of Attachments: - None Nicholas Veronies Attorney Patrick R. Seidel, Esq. Silverman, Thompson, Slutkin White 400 E. Pratt Street, Suite 900 Baltimore, Maryland 21202 Office: (410) 385-2225 Direct: (410) 385-9105 Fax: (410) 547-2432 pseidel@silvermanthompson.com Narrative: Since the last update, I, Cpl. Theodore Buck of the Maryland State Police was notified that the suspect retained an attorney in the case listed above. I was advised that VERONIE did not want to provide a statement at this time. I did provide P. Seidel, Esq. a summary of the case information and requested that he ask VERONIE if he would like to provide the contact information for anyone I should speak with. When/if I am provided a list of names and can speak with them, any information learned will be included in a future supplement. After reviewing the case information and the interviews, I confirmed with Assistant States Attorney S. Johnson that I could extend the investigation to try and gather additional information from witnesses I have had contact with and try to identify the other parties at the scene. If any new information is learned, it will be included in the case file for review. Case to remain OPEN.

List of Attachments: - None Narrative: As of October 18, 2023, I, Cpl. Theodore Buck of the Maryland State Police Criminal Enforcement Division have not heard from VERONIEs attorney about a list of names and contacts of VERONIE, who were at the truck meet. Additionally, I learned that VERONIE did not want to provide a statement. I was attempting to gain the other side of the story before contacting the witnesses already interviewed. It should be noted that I provided P. Seidel, Esq, with a summary of the incident and my request to identify more people his client may know; however, as of 10/18/23, I have not received a response to this request. On October 18, 2023, I contacted the witnesses listed below to arrange a time to conduct a follow-up interview with them. Additionally, I requested the names and contacts of everyone they knew at the scene of the incident in an attempt to identify more people. It should be noted that one of the founders of the meet-up put my phone number out to the group; however, I was not contacted by anyone. List of People Contacted: Logan Daniel BOCKELMANN (05/24/2004). 443-536-1736. Christopher John REED (07/29/2004). 443-547-5265. Tyler Stuart PERDUE (11/23/2004). 443-904-1045. Colby Taylor JACKSON (11/25/2003). 443-547-0253. Mason WALTRUP (02/14/2002) 410-299-2756. Nate Marsh 240-385-5812. Mason CONNERS (11/22/2005) -JUVENILE 443-536-4254 (or 4259). contacted both variations of the phone number. Once more information is learned, it will be captured in a future supplement for review. Case OPEN.

List of Attachments: - Copy of the Recorded phone interview with Logan Bockelmann. List of People Contacted and their Statements: It should be noted that contact was attempted previously; however, I had to reschedule my follow-up interviews. Logan Daniel BOCKELMANN (05/24/2004). 443-536-1736. Contacted on 11/7/2023. Message left. 11/7/23 at 02:07 P.M. - Interview conducted. Advised he would provide my number to his ex-girlfriend the next time he saw her. Logan indicated that the suspect was antagonizing people on the night of the incident and the day prior. Logan confirmed that he did not think there was any reason the suspect should have felt he needed to defend himself. 11/13/2023 Logan advised that his ex-girlfriend did not want to be involved and would not provide her contact information. Christopher John REED (07/29/2004). 443-547-5265. Contacted on 11/7/2023. Wearranged to speak on November 10th. Tyler Stuart PERDUE (11/23/2004). 443-904-1045. Contacted on 11/7/2023. Message left. Colby Taylor JACKSON (11/25/2003). 443-547-0253. Contacted on 11/7/2023. We arranged to speak in the coming days; Colby was asked to send me some dates and times that work for him. Mason WALTRUP (02/14/2002) 410-299-2756. Contacted on 11/7/23. We arranged to speak in the coming days. Nate Marsh 240-385-5812. Contacted on 11/7/23. Message left. Mason CONNERS (11/22/2005) -JUVENILE 443-536-4254. Confirmed this number - updated from the previous supplement. Contacted on 11/7/23. Message left. Other Possible Witnesses: Chris girlfriend - Brooke. Contact information is possibly pending. Logans ex-girlfriend - Brooke. Contact information is possibly pending. UPDATED Information: As of November 17, 2023, no additional interviews have been able to be conducted as I have not heard from the other victims. Additionally, BOCKELMANN indicated in a follow-up conversation that his ex-girlfriend did not want to discuss the case. Further contact will be attempted, as well as further review with the Carroll County States Attorneys Office. Case to remain OPEN.

List of Attachments: - None Narrative: As of December 2023, the only follow-up interview able to be completed was with the main victim,BOCKELMANN. The other victims in the case are not returning calls. Additionally, no new names of other witnesses have been provided by any of the known witnesses. Based on this information, I contacted the Carroll County States Attorneys Office and requested a review. Once a determination is made, it will be captured in a future supplement. Case to remain OPEN.
